feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system lacks automated salary calculation based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: Significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation exists.

known_issues.title: Daily Wage Formula Inconsistency Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the formula configured in leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is being superseded by payroll settings. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrectly Handles Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system does not correctly account for 366 days in leap years when calculating end of service gratuity, resulting in incorrect service period and benefit calculations. When calculating for 2024 (a leap year), the system uses 365 days instead of 366 days, leading to a lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations. The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) slightly differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485), but support confirmed system calculation is correct based on service duration and daily wage formula
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex service duration splitting and tiered daily rates

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation showed 913 days by including the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Potential inconsistency in counting leap year days for service duration calculation
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for transparent documentation on how leap year days are handled in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Extra Day Added in Gratuity Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing job tenure, potentially causing slight variations in gratuity calculation
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked count during gratuity calculation

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary using a fixed daily rate divisor (potentially 30 days) which may not accurately reflect calendar month variations. User expected calculation based on 31 days, but system used 30 days, resulting in a slight salary amount difference.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation uses a predefined divisor that may not flexibly adjust to different month lengths
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in how daily wage divisor is configured and applied in leave salary calculations

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Varies by Monthly Working Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals across months
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, causing accrual reporting inconsistency
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. This is a system design limitation where leave salary and salary proration use independent daily wage formulas.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations use separate configurations that may produce different results.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Misinterpretation of Working Days Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not align with traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap exists in handling dynamic proration scenarios for payroll calculations

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions During Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes misaligned between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are configured after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for enhanced module communication to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Complexity
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates daily wage using a custom divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculated by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 (not calendar days), potentially causing deduction amounts to exceed expected monthly salary
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction. Remarks show 31 days instead of 29 days, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct. This is a display bug in the remarks field where the wrong number of days is referenced.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions. The global setting calculates deductions using a method different from the configured policy (Basic Salary / Working Days).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Calculation Shows Incorrect Month
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is inconsistent with the leave period.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate recalculated based on payroll processing month rather than stored from leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for consistent daily rate display that preserves initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days per Month Standard
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary calculation is based on a fixed 26 working days per month standard (313 working days per year, excluding 52 weekly offs).
limitations.impact: Rigid salary calculation method that does not flexibly accommodate individual employee attendance variations

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.
limitations.impact: Leave policy formulas are greyed out and cannot override payroll settings for daily wage calculations

limitations.title: Salary Configuration Dependency for Leave Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave requests

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years in Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits

limitations.title: Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations for pro-rated amounts are consistently undercalculated by small decimal points (0.1 or 0.2) when computing End of Service settlements.
limitations.impact: Employees may receive slightly less than their expected pro-rated salary during final settlements

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are only accrued at month-end, preventing prorated inclusion for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include that month's leave balance in End of Service settlement

limitations.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether the departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are incorporated
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Fixed 30-Day Divisor for Daily Wage
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is always calculated using (Basic Salary / 30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, preventing easy customization for specific employee scenarios
limitations.impact: Users cannot override standard calculation method based on unique monthly variations

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Method Impacts Accrual
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment can be calculated using 'working days' or 'custom days' settings, which directly impacts monthly accrual calculations
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary amounts will vary based on the selected calculation method

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations that cannot automatically align without manual configuration.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies between leave salary and salary proration

limitations.title: Proration Calculation Depends on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Salary calculation may differ from traditional calendar day expectations depending on work week setup

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Incomplete Deduction Removal on Leave Request Deletion
limitations.limitation_statement: When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Precise daily wage depends on accurate working days configuration and cannot be changed retroactively

limitations.title: Custom Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses 30.42 days as divisor for daily wage calculation, not standard calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not precisely match monthly salary expectations

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations use calendar days, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate unpaid leave deductions by using the precise number of calendar days in each month

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of automated attendance-based salary calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually track overtime and unpaid leaves separately for each employee, using a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent daily wage formula display between leave policy and payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll daily wage calculator intentionally configured to override leave policy formula for unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings, which takes precedence for unpaid leave calculations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect pro-rated amount showing less than expected (e.g., 89,999.9 instead of 9,000)
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Escalate to development team for precise calculation fix

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Leave balance for departure month not automatically included
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Monthly accrual policy requires full month completion to grant leave days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust EOS balance in the system or switch to conditional daily accrual policy

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in total service days calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Uncertainty about whether departure date and leap year days are consistently counted in service duration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify service days calculation, particularly for leap years and departure date inclusion

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and calculated leave salary amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses fixed daily rate configuration from leave policy, which may not match user expectations about calendar day calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy and understand how system calculates prorated salary

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected differences in monthly leave salary accrual totals
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, causing monthly calculation variations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Switch to 'custom days' setting for more consistent leave encashment calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Mismatched leave salary calculation compared to expected proration
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different divisors used for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align daily wage configurations or use consistent divisor across calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Apparent discrepancy in salary proration calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify work week configuration to understand how working days are defined for the specific employee
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's assigned work week policy and confirm if all 7 days are marked as working days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Salary not prorated correctly for offboarded employees
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation logic fails to handle departure dates relative to payroll processing date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify and adjust salary calculations for employees with non-standard departure dates

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Payroll deductions remain after leave request deletion
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of synchronization between leave management and payroll systems
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual removal of orphaned deductions may be required

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Salary deduction amount differs from expected full month salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Mismatch in working days calculation due to late public holiday configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually add deduction to correct the calculation discrepancy

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between displayed daily rate and actual calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Remarks field shows incorrect number of days, but actual calculation uses correct calendar days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify actual deduction amount by calculating daily rate using correct number of calendar days for the specific month

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect unpaid leave deduction calculation using gross salary instead of basic salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific calculation method
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global unpaid leave daily rate settings and understand the configuration hierarchy

claims_to_validate.title: Misinterpretation of Working Days Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions During Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes misaligned between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Complexity
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates daily wage using a custom divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction. Remarks show 31 days instead of 29 days, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct. This is a display bug in the remarks field where the wrong number of days is referenced.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions. The global setting calculates deductions using a method different from the configured policy (Basic Salary / Working Days).

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Calculation Shows Incorrect Month
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is inconsistent with the leave period.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days per Month Standard
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary calculation is based on a fixed 26 working days per month standard (313 working days per year, excluding 52 weekly offs).

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Configuration Dependency for Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years in Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations for pro-rated amounts are consistently undercalculated by small decimal points (0.1 or 0.2) when computing End of Service settlements.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are only accrued at month-end, preventing prorated inclusion for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether the departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are incorporated

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30-Day Divisor for Daily Wage
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is always calculated using (Basic Salary / 30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, preventing easy customization for specific employee scenarios

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Method Impacts Accrual
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment can be calculated using 'working days' or 'custom days' settings, which directly impacts monthly accrual calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations that cannot automatically align without manual configuration.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Depends on Work Week Setup
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates

claims_to_validate.title: Incomplete Deduction Removal on Leave Request Deletion
claims_to_validate.statement: When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

claims_to_validate.title: Custom Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses 30.42 days as divisor for daily wage calculation, not standard calendar days

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations use calendar days, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
